title: CI can't `hg pull` for pull requests from private forks

content.raw:
Here is an example of a pull request from a private fork to a public repo:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/pull-requests/100/merge-private-into-public/diff

The jenkins build failed since it was unable to `hg pull` from the private repo:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64&build=23)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/23/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/subt-ci-pr_any-bionic-amd64/23/

One option would be to use the bitbucket API to get the diff proposed by the pull request and apply that to the target branch:

* https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/osrf/subt/pullrequests/100/diff

For this specific pull request, I'm not worried about the CI, but I thought it would be good to be aware of this issue in case we get more pull requests from private forks.
